column4: Runing the scripts can finish all operations of building up modules   from the source code and start the nic.   1. Build up the drivers from the source code     ./makedrv     2. load the driver module to kernel and start up nic     ./wlan0up
should I just click on makedrv file?
can some one help me? I am trying to install RTL8187 driver
what does this mean: "Build up the drivers from the source code     ./makedrv"?
I am trying to install driver
Build up the drivers from the source code     ./makedrv
open the console, go to the directory with the file to install and type: sudo sh <fileName>
is there some file like make?
owner@owner-laptop:~/Desktop/rtl8187_linux_26.1025.0328.2007$ make makedrv make: *** No rule to make target `makedrv'.  Stop.

< Installation >  Runing the scripts can finish all operations of building up modules   from the source code and start the nic.   1. Build up the drivers from the source code     ./makedrv     2. load the driver module to kernel and start up nic     ./wlan0up
in the driver directory type: sh makedrv
